bug.summary: Bug in resize for 5 channels images
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => 4.2 Operating System / Platform => Ubuntu 16.04 Compiler => ‚ùî
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
I'm using python bindings for opencv and found a bug with resizing images with 5 channels. It works fine for any other number of channels. I've also checked previous versions and it works in 4.1.1. So the bug should be very recent <denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import numpy as np import cv2 arr = np.ones((1200, 1200, 5), dtype=np.uint8) cv2.resize(arr, (512, 512)) </denchmark-code>
for me it fails with double free or corruption (!prev)

comments.comment:
Reproduced without Python: <denchmark-code> Mat src(Size(1200, 1200), CV_MAKETYPE(CV_8U, 5), Scalar::all(0)); Mat dst; resize(src, dst, Size(512, 512)); </denchmark-code>
